results.title: Exploring the heart and mind
results.creator_credit: Center for Humanities, Eve Cotton and Leslie Ann Nathan
results.brief_description: This program discusses the Expressionist and Surrealist artists who sought to reveal deep feelings and subconscious thoughts in their painting. It includes work by Rousseau, Redon, Rouault, Matisse, Nolde, Kirchner, Kandinski and others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Center for Humanities, Eve Cotton and Leslie Ann Nathan

results.title: Exploring the atomic nucleus
results.brief_description: Protons and neutrons are now known to be composed of dozens of other particles whose interactions have yet to be accurately described. Physicists are detecting and analysing particle interactions with the aid of particle accelerators, bubble chambers and other sophisticated devices of high energy physics, thus arriving at a fuller understanding of the atomic nucleus.

results.title: Exploring space: the sun and its energy. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Media and Lee W. Gluckman
results.brief_description: Uses simulation to show the space shuttle Enterprise placing a solar observatory into orbit. Describes the sun’s physical characteristics, explains its effect on earth and briefly the possibilities of solar energy.

results.title: Exploring our solar system
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Sidney Platt
results.brief_description: This video explores the Milky Way from the center to its outer limits using computer enhanced footage from NASA and specially commissioned animation based on information obtained during Voyager 2’s flyby of Neptune in 1989. Beginning with the Sun, each of the main features of the planets is described, including the earth and our moon. A description of the ways in which the solar system is investigated, including telescopes and manned and unmanned space travel is also included. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teachers guide included.

results.title: Exploring occupational health and safety
results.brief_description: Trainers and occupational health and safety managers will welcome this training package for employees which has been made in Australia expressly for Australasian conditions. Aimed particularly at the induction level employee, it is equally useful as a general refresher program or as an educational introduction to occupational health and safety. Hosted by Margaret Throsby, the issues covered by the program include management and employee responsibilities under the new legislation; the role of the National Occupational Health and Safety Commission; factors contributing to major health and safety problems such as RSI; functions of safety committees, quality circles and industrial democracy; and legal safety standards.

results.title: Exploring New Zealand's fiordland
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and Stanhope Andrews
results.brief_description: A joint expedition of New Zealand and American research workers into New Zealand’s fiordlands to study fauna and flora and to prepare maps of the area. Narrated by Briton Chadwick.

results.title: Exploring mathematics: the weird number
results.brief_description: Presents an amusing introduction of rational numbers to a community of natural numbers. The weird number, 2/3, steals a piece of cake and then leads the major and the baker on a merry chase. Suitable middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Exploring in space: the Van Allen radiation belts
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Charles Probst
results.brief_description: Dr James Van Allen and other scientists explain some of the purposes and methods of obtaining information in exploratory space flights. Uses animated drawings, models and live photography to visualise the relationships between the earth, the sun, the magnetosphere, and the radiation belts, and to explain how radio equipped space craft explore the radiation regions.
